paper_metadata.title: Leveraging social protection for women's engagement in sustainable land management

program_information.program_name: SPIR II (Strengthen Productive Safety Net Program Institutions and Resilience II)

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Ethiopia's national safety program, the Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP), which provides consumption support in the form of cash and food transfers

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The innovation tested includes providing training (to either women only or to both men and women from same households) and free inputs (tree seedlings, vegetable seeds and tools for home gardening)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The goal of the SLM innovation being tested is to leverage social protection to promote women's engagement in sustainable land management practices
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: a quantitative impact evaluation testing the innovation

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: This sustainable land management (SLM) innovation draws on qualitative formative research

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: SPIR II (Strengthen Productive Safety Net Program Institutions and Resilience II) that seeks to further sustain nutrition security and reduce risks to livelihoods for households participating in the Ethiopia's national safety program
evidence_citations.country_citation: extreme weather events pose risks for poor households in rural Ethiopia
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: households participating in the Ethiopia's national safety program, the Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP)
